snippet: The White House is girding itself for an extended period of turmoil that will test the security of American diplomatic missions and President Obama’s ability to shape the forces of change in the Arab world.
abstract: Obama administration is girding itself for an extended period of turmoil that will test the security of American diplomatic missions and Pres Obama's ability to shape the forces of change in the Arab world; upheaval over an anti-Islam video has become Obama's most serious foreign policy crisis of the election season, and analysts say it presents questions about central tenets of his Middle East policy and his response to the Arab Spring.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and MARK LANDLER

lead_paragraph: The White House is girding itself for an extended period of turmoil that will test the security of American diplomatic missions and President Obama’s ability to shape the forces of change in the Arab world.

headline.main: U.S. Is Preparing for a Long Siege of Arab Unrest
headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Preparing For a Long Siege Of Arab Unrest

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
